page.title: 06SMALL FARMS, WHITBURN
page.content: Mr.John Holmes who owns{Moor Farm}was too busy to allow us to visit his farm, but he talked to us on the telephone instead. He told us that he has an open day on his farm in July every year, when anyone can go and see the milk being bottled. We found out that his small dairy farm covers 240 acres, all of it is grazing land. It has 230 milking cows and 200 rearing stock. The farm has its own bottling machines and milk vans, and they deliver milk, cream and their own make of yoghourt to hundreds of houses in Whitburn, Boldon, South Shields and Sunderland. Mr.Nichol, who runs{West Hall Farm} nearby, invited us to his much smaller farm where he grows mainly cereals and turnips to feed his calves in the winter. He said we were the first school to ever visit his farm.
